column3: Company! I could use a friendly face around here. Well, a face at any rate. You adventurers aren't exactly known for your good looks, but I'll wager a yalm of ale you're bold enough to hunt an elite mark.
Tell me about the rank B elite mark. (Dark Helmet)
Tell me about the rank A elite mark. (Nahn)
Tell me about the rank S elite mark. (Bonnacon)
I wear the rocks down running after elite marks, what else? But someone's got to make the place safe for the commonfolk. And the rocks, well, there's too many of 'em anyway!
Oh, don't go thinking I'm high-minded or nothing. I'm well paid when the marks are well killed! The bounty's in Allied Seals, and that's as good as gil these days.

You don't know much about the elite marks in these parts, I'll wager. Sure, I can help a \x02\x08\x14\xe9\x05\xff\x07sister\xff\x08brother\x03 hunter out if you're quick about it. Make your queries before the sun \x02\x08V\xe3\xe9\x0c\r\xff'\x02\x08#\xe3\xe9\x0c\x05\xff\tcomes up\xff\x13climbs much higher\x03\xff(\x02\x08$\xe3\xe9\x0c\x12\xff\x14burns us to a crisp\xff\tcomes up\x03\x03.

But first things first: heed the ranks. Chase a rank S and it's like to be a fool's errand\xe2\x94\x80and a dead fool, too, if you chase long enough. Try something less dangerous, like an A or, easier yet, a rank B elite mark.
bxe2\x80\x9cA hermit crab of less eremitic bent
column4: Dark Helmet began its love affair with armor when it traded in its snail shell for some nameless Lalafell's helm."

column3: bxe2\x80\x9cIts salvaging ways abandoned on the sands alongside outgrown and rusted headgear
column4: Dark Helmet lives to acquire larger and finer heaumes\xe2\x94\x80often still occupied by their former owners' grey matter.\xe2\x80\x9d "

column3: \xe2\x80\x9cA native of the Indigo Deep, Nahn is a gargantuan man-eating crustacean. Its actual name is unpronounceable except under the crushing press of water.
\xe2\x80\x9cThe Sahagin of the Sapsa Spawning Grounds are responsible for bringing Nahn to shore to serve as a living weapon against the Maelstrom and others inimical to the beastmen.\xe2\x80\x9d
\xe2\x80\x9cOnce known as a mild and even affectionate beast, Bonnacon is afflicted with a fit that comes upon him like a caul of fire.

\xe2\x80\x9cTossing his great head in torment and rage, this bull gores to death his unfortunate victims, many of them greengrocers. Phrontists have implicated a rare variety of vegetable\xe2\x94\x80its smell, to be precise\xe2\x94\x80in triggering the violent attack.\xe2\x80\x9d
The Maelstrom should worry a mite less about fish and a mite more about these other creatures, if you ask me\xe2\x94\x80the kind that's killing folk right now in western La Noscea, for example.
